Naja es macht dennoch SpaÃŸ. Besonders mit Freunden, wenn man denn mal ne Lobby finden wÃ¼rde.

There are a lot of weird bugs like randomly dropping connectivity, laggy host connections, de-ranking when you have no control over the situation (killer DC or connectivity issues), trolly teammates, salty post-game chats and more.

BUT.

I have to say, the way this game works and playing it? I love it. I love playing it with my friends. I like how it works, I like the idea of running from a killer or chasing down my friends. It's some of the most fun gameplay I have had over the last year since its' release and I see myself playing it lots more. I am very-goal oriented, so I enjoy building up blood points to spend or earning currency to unlock teachables in the shrine. It has a solid "progress" feel for those who put in the time. 

Some of the DLC released is free, and all of it is under $7, so it's not hard to keep up to date.

I will likely put plenty of more time into this, bugs and salt aside.

Best game ever!!! really addicting, been playing for a month now.....never got bored of it. Definitely recommend it.

What used to be an asymmetrical survival game has turned into a clown fiesta. Gone are the days where the killer was feared, instead it's become a playhouse where the survivors have become so powerful that killers might as well be giving out hugs. Curse your way through not so procedurally generated stages as you get tea bagged and exploited back to the realm of unneccesity. As of this review, most of the perks that are gamebreaking give survivors temporary invulnerabilty, reward them for bad gameplay and basically neuter the killer before the match even starts. 

With the use of voice communication that was never implented or intended in the game, it also allows them to know your location at all time with noting that you can do about it but run amuck as they loop you endlessly with the billions of generated pallets that allow them to escape before you can say "what the fuck!?".

 I've played both sides and I'll tell you it is extremely easy to survive in this game using just these steps. Group up (doesn't matter if it's your friends or not as long as they have speakers you're covered), load up discord and share all the information that the devs can't do anything about. There's also a large amount of exploits and bugs that go unfixed for lengthy periods of time such as add-ons on items that they were never intended to be combined with giving unlimited use, survivors disconnecting punishing the killer with less points while also being able to keep rare items they don't want to lose, killers having to navigate a ridiculous 'victory cube' in order to rank up and survivors literally having to do nothing but hide in a locker until they want to escape without any requirements while still ranking up.

The devs continue to not want to discuss such things during their live stream while other companies welcome open forums of discussion thus showing they are actually trying to balance the game for all players rather than pandering to one side while all the while ignoring to punish those people who are exploiting and being vile/toxic within the community.


:::UPDATE:::

So they've finally added balances to the game, fixed pallets and have overall turned this whole franchise around. Definitely impressed with the work they've done to make sure it's not so one sided anymore.
I love this game! Its not perfect and some of the killers are frustrating but the game is completely exhilarating!!
